greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(n*(n+1),n)/(n+1).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..338
R. Mestrovic, Wolstenholme's theorem: Its Generalizations and Extensions in the last hundred and fifty years (1862-2011), arXiv:1111.3057 [math.NT], 2011.
formula: Supercongruences: a(p) == 1 ( mod p^4 ) for prime p >= 5 and a(2*p) == 4*p + 1 ( mod p^4 ) for prime p >= 5 (apply Mestrovic, equation 37). - _Peter Bala_, Feb 23 2020
a(n) ~ exp(n + 1/2) * n^(n - 3/2) / sqrt(2*Pi). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 17 2020
maple: A135861:=n->binomial(n*(n+1),n)/(n+1); seq(A135861(n), n=0..15); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 08 2014
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 02 2007
